dynamicNodes.name: LEGO Technic
desc: The bricks with holes that put functionality over beauty.
Used and abused hard during childhood.

dynamicNodes.name: LEGO Mindstorms
desc: Simple block-style programming for LEGO robots.
Used as late as 2019 to drop plastic spiders on trick-or-treaters

dynamicNodes.name: Percussion
desc: A keeper of time and drummer of drums from 4th to 8th grade.
I can keep precise time up to around 770BPM.

dynamicNodes.name: Redstone
desc: Laid the foundations for my understanding of boolean logic.
Minecraft also started me memorizing my powers of two.

dynamicNodes.name: Woodworking
desc: Officially picked up in 8th grade.
I can use a variety of woodshop tools safely.

dynamicNodes.name: Audacity
desc: Does audio & waveform editing.
I'm capable of making song mashups that aren't actually terrible.

dynamicNodes.name: Adobe Photoshop
desc: Edits images in almost any way imaginable.
Can create from scratch too, but illustrator is usually better for that.

dynamicNodes.name: Expression 2
desc: My first true coding language.
Part of an addon for the popular sandbox game, Garry's Mod.

dynamicNodes.name: Adobe Illustrator
desc: Creates and edits vector graphics, which display crisply at all resolutions.
Most of these nodes use vector graphics.

dynamicNodes.name: GIMP
desc: The GNU Image Manipulation Program.
Open-source, free, and 9 times out of 10 better than photoshop.

dynamicNodes.name: Autodesk 123D Design
desc: The deprecated predecessor to Fusion 360.
Immensely powerful, easy to use, and free.

dynamicNodes.name: Adobe After Effects
desc: Photoshop for video; puts the FX in VFX.
Used for many disgraceful memes and edits.

dynamicNodes.name: Blender
desc: The 3D multipurpose program with a brutal learning curve
Used here and there in multiple different projects.

dynamicNodes.name: 3D Printing
desc: Abused so badly in Odyssey of the Mind that a policy was implemented to nerf my 3D printing!
The nerf was a feeble attempt to stop me.

dynamicNodes.name: Code.org / ES1 JavaScript
desc: ES1 JavaScript from Code.org's App Lab.
These nodes use modified physics code from an App Lab project.

dynamicNodes.name: Arduino
desc: A C-style language simplified enough for an amateur to pick up.
Used in Odyssey of the Mind in 2019 and helped us place second at world finals!

dynamicNodes.name: C
desc: Learned during second and third years of college.
Haven't mastered it, but I know the core concepts.

dynamicNodes.name: Java
desc: Learned during AP Computer Science A.
I used it to extend my Discord relay to a Minecraft server, but it sucked.

dynamicNodes.name: Adobe Premiere
desc: For compiling audio and video clips.
I used this my senior year of high school for editing the school's news show.

dynamicNodes.name: Calculus
desc: Learned During AP Calc AB.
I'm self taught on some concepts from Calc C!

dynamicNodes.name: Desmos
desc: An inspiring, free, and turing-complete online graphing calculator.
Anything is possible if you're determined enough!

dynamicNodes.name: Lua
desc: A common language of game scripting.
I know the variant used in Garry's Mod.

dynamicNodes.name: NodeJS
desc: ES6 JavaScript as a backend.
Runs the peripherals of my Garry's Mod server and auto-restarts it when it crashes.

dynamicNodes.name: JavaScript
desc: ES6+ Specifications; modern JavaScript without frameworks.
Most frameworks are garbage; I somewhat regret the Svelte rewrite of this portfolio.

dynamicNodes.name: CSS
desc: Formatting the web with extravagant <style>
A constant source of frustration, but usually worth the struggle.

dynamicNodes.name: HTML
desc: The skeleton and structure of websites, and a subset of the wider XML family.

dynamicNodes.name: Regex
desc: Forbidden pattern-matching runes with immense power.
Most familiar with the EMCAScript variant.

dynamicNodes.name: Ubuntu/Linux
desc: ùöúùöûùöçùöò‚ÄÇùöåùöëùöòùö†ùöó‚ÄÇ-ùöÅ ùöèùöäùöúùöùùöéùöõùöòùöíùöç‚ÄÇ/
wait frick üíÄ
I recovered in 4 hours with no real backups!

dynamicNodes.name: Bash
desc: The beloved Bourne Again Shell.
After the above incident, I wrote a bash script for automated backups.

dynamicNodes.name: Electron
desc: Desktop apps made by web developers!
Used to build an app for my dad that helps him automate patient data at work.

dynamicNodes.name: Bootstrap CSS
desc: Learned during my third year of college.
I'm beginning to see the appeal.

dynamicNodes.name: TypeScript
desc: It's JavaScript, but BETTER!
I literally cannot live without it now.

dynamicNodes.name: WebGL
desc: A terrifying low-level GPU API for the web.
Do NOT approach outside of Shadertoy.

dynamicNodes.name: Adobe ColdFusion
desc: A serverside scripting language written with XML tags.
Stupid and confusing, but lovable like Expression 2.

dynamicNodes.name: Angular
desc: A powerful framework for reusable web components.
Why can't I inherit decorators in Angular 11 though?

dynamicNodes.name: Angular Material
desc: A set of default-ish components for Angular.
They honestly just look better than their HTML counterparts.

dynamicNodes.name: Sass
desc: What if you could nest CSS class definitions?
Finally, compact and sensible CSS!
